title: Mystery Theater Dressing Room Adventure #13
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Star's Dressing Room
rooms.description: An elegant dressing room with a large mirror surrounded by bright bulbs. Costumes hang on a brass rack, and makeup covers an antique vanity. The walls are adorned with framed playbills and photographs of past performances. The scent of greasepaint and perfume lingers in the air. A heavy velvet curtain conceals the door to the backstage area.

items.name: antique vanity table
items.description: A beautiful vanity with an ornate mirror and several drawers filled with theatrical makeup

items.name: opening night program
items.description: A vintage program from the theater's grand opening
items.text: GRAND OPENING - The Midnight Theater, Est. 1923. Tonight's Performance: 'The Phantom's Masquerade' directed by the legendary Vincent Blackwood. Lead Actor: Madame Celeste Noir. Stage Manager: Thomas Grey. This historic theater shall stand as a monument to the dramatic arts!

items.name: ornate brass key
items.description: A decorative brass key with theatrical masks engraved on the handle

items.name: costume rack
items.description: A brass rack holding elaborate period costumes and cloaks

items.name: director's letter
items.description: A letter tucked into a costume pocket
items.text: My Dearest Celeste, tonight's performance of 'The Phantom's Masquerade' will be our greatest triumph! I have hidden the key to the prop room in your vanity - the combination is the year our beloved Midnight Theater opened its doors. Break a leg! - Vincent

items.name: collection of framed playbills
items.description: Vintage playbills from famous productions at the Midnight Theater
items.text: Featured productions: 'The Phantom's Masquerade' (1923), 'Midnight Sonata' (1925), 'The Crimson Curtain' (1927). All directed by Vincent Blackwood, starring Madame Celeste Noir.

items.name: theatrical trunk
items.description: A large steamer trunk covered in travel stickers and locked with a brass padlock

items.name: script pages
items.description: Pages from 'The Phantom's Masquerade' script
items.text: Act III, Scene 2: The phantom reveals himself in the prop room, surrounded by masks and mirrors. The final confrontation takes place on the grand stage, where truth and illusion merge.

items.name: stage manager's notes
items.description: Thomas Grey's production notes
items.text: Production Notes: All props stored in the prop room backstage. Director Blackwood insists on perfection. Madame Noir's performance is breathtaking. The grand stage awaits the final act. Emergency exit through stage door requires authorization.

items.name: velvet curtain concealing door
items.description: A heavy burgundy curtain hiding a door that leads to the backstage prop room

rooms.name: Backstage Prop Room
rooms.description: A cluttered room filled with theatrical props, masks, and set pieces. Shelves line the walls, packed with everything from fake swords to ornate candelabras. Mannequins wearing various costumes stand in the corners like silent witnesses. A workbench holds tools and paint. The air smells of sawdust and old fabric. A grand door with theatrical masks carved into it leads to the stage.

items.name: prop storage shelves
items.description: Tall shelves crammed with theatrical props and set decorations

items.name: phantom's mask
items.description: An ornate half-mask from 'The Phantom's Masquerade' production
items.text: The iconic mask worn in the climactic scene. A note attached reads: 'The phantom's identity is revealed in the prop room, but his legacy lives on the grand stage.'

items.name: prop master's workbench
items.description: A sturdy workbench covered with tools, paint, and half-finished props

items.name: theater history book
items.description: A book documenting the Midnight Theater's illustrious past
items.text: THE MIDNIGHT THEATER: A History. Founded in 1923 by visionary director Vincent Blackwood. The opening production, 'The Phantom's Masquerade,' starred the incomparable Madame Celeste Noir. The grand stage has hosted countless legendary performances. To access the stage, one must prove knowledge of our heritage.

items.name: costume mannequins
items.description: Several mannequins dressed in elaborate costumes from past productions

items.name: signed photograph
items.description: A black and white photograph of Madame Celeste Noir in costume
items.text: Photograph of Madame Celeste Noir as the lead in 'The Phantom's Masquerade.' Her signature reads: 'To my beloved Midnight Theater - where dreams become reality. Forever yours, Celeste Noir.'

items.name: director's chair
items.description: A folding chair with 'VINCENT BLACKWOOD - DIRECTOR' stenciled on the back

items.name: director's journal
items.description: Vincent Blackwood's personal production journal
items.text: Final Entry: Tonight, 'The Phantom's Masquerade' opens on our grand stage. Celeste is magnificent. The prop room is ready. Everything is perfect. To enter the stage for the final act, one must answer the three questions of theatrical knowledge. Only then can the performance reach its conclusion.

items.name: grand stage door
items.description: An impressive door carved with theatrical masks - comedy and tragedy. Three questions are inscribed on a brass plaque mounted beside it.

password_questions.question: Who directed the opening production?
password_questions.hint: Check the opening night program and theater history book

password_questions.question: What was the opening production called?
password_questions.hint: Multiple documents mention the theater's first performance

password_questions.question: Who was the lead actor?
password_questions.hint: Look at the program, photograph, and various notes about the star

rooms.name: The Grand Stage
rooms.description: You step onto the magnificent grand stage of the Midnight Theater! The vast auditorium stretches before you with rows of plush red velvet seats rising to ornate balconies. A crystal chandelier hangs from the painted ceiling. The stage lights illuminate you like a star. The heavy curtains are drawn back, and the stage door at the rear stands open, revealing the night air and freedom beyond.

items.name: grand crystal chandelier
items.description: A spectacular chandelier casting brilliant light across the theater

items.name: velvet stage curtains
items.description: Heavy burgundy curtains framing the stage, drawn back to reveal the auditorium

items.name: stage spotlight
items.description: Bright theatrical lights illuminating the stage in a warm glow

items.name: portrait of the phantom
items.description: A large portrait hanging above the stage showing the phantom character from the famous production
items.text: The phantom watches over the stage eternally, a reminder of the Midnight Theater's legendary opening night in 1923.

rooms.win_message: Bravo! You have reached the grand stage and solved the mysteries of the Midnight Theater! As you stand in the spotlight where legends once performed, you feel the weight of theatrical history. The stage door opens to the cool night air, and you exit triumphantly. The ghosts of Vincent Blackwood and Madame Celeste Noir would be proud. The curtain falls on your adventure. You win!
